questions.question: Given that f(x) = 3x^3 + 6x^2 - 7x - 2, show that x + 1 is a factor of f(x) and hence factorise f(x) completely.
questions.category: Polynomials, cubic equations and partial fractions
questions.question_type: Factor theorem and solving a cubic equation, Long division/synthetic method/remainder theorem

questions.question: The equation of a circle is (x - 3)^2 + (y + 4)^2 = 26. Determine if the origin O lies inside or outside the circle.
questions.question_type: Finding equation of circle and determining if a point lies on, is inside, or outside a circle

questions.question: Solve the equation e^(2x) - e^x = 3, giving your answer(s) correct to 3 significant figures.
Given that y = 3x^3 - 16x^5, find (i) the value(s) of x for which dy/dx = 1, (ii) the value of the integral from 0 to 1 of y dx, giving your answer correct to 3 significant figures.
questions.question_type: Applications of differentiation to tangents and normals

questions.question: 5(a) (i) Using the substitution z = 1 + x, write down all the terms in the expansion of (1 + x)^6, leaving each term in the form (1 + kx)^p where k and p are integers. (ii) Hence show that the remainder when (2 + x)^6 is divided by 1 + x is 1. (b) Given that the coefficient of x^2 in the expansion of (1 + 2x)(1 - px)^5 is 20, find the two possible values of the constant p.
questions.question_type: Applications of binomial theorem, Finding coefficients of specific terms, Finding values of unknown coefficients

questions.question: 6 At time t seconds, the velocity, v m/s, of a metal ball falling through a very thick liquid is given by v = 8(1 - e^(-t/3)). (i) State the initial velocity of the ball. (ii) Find an expression for the depth of the ball in terms of t. (iii) Show that the ball is accelerating throughout its motion. (iv) Deduce the motion of the ball for large values of t.
questions.question_type: Application of differentiation and integration, given velocity

questions.question: 7 The diagram shows a quadrilateral ABCD with angles ABC and ADC both equal to 90°. Angle BAD = θ. The lengths of AB, BC and CD are 5 m, 1 m and 3 m respectively. The point F on AD is such that BF is perpendicular to AD. (i) Show that the length of BF is cos θ + 3. (ii) Hence show that 5sin θ - cos θ = 3. (iii) By expressing 5sin θ - cos θ in the form R sin(θ - α), where R > 0 and 0° < α < 90°, find the value of θ.
questions.question_type: Solving trigonometric equations using basic trigonometric identity, Solving trigonometric equations using compound angle formulae, R-formula

questions.question: 8 The equation of a curve C1 is y = 3x^2 - 6x. (i) Show that the coordinates of the maximum point of the curve C1 are (1, 3). (ii) Using your answer in part (i), state the range of values of k for which the curve C1 lies entirely below the line y = k. The curve C2 is the reflection of the curve C1 in the line y = k, where k takes one of the values found in part (ii). (iii) Deduce the equation of the curve C2, giving your answer in terms of k.
questions.question_type: The most appropriate question type from the list for the given question is: Finding equation of perpendicular bisector.

questions.question: Another line y = x + a is a tangent to the curve C1 at the point P. (iv) Find the value of the constant a.
(v) Find the coordinates of P.
questions.question_type: Finding coordinates of unknown collinear point

questions.question: 9 The equation of a circle is 224 12 36 x y x y+ − − + = 0. The equation of the line L is y = kx, where k is a constant. (i) Find the radius of the circle and the coordinates of its centre.
questions.question_type: Finding equation of circle and determining if a point lies on, is inside, or outside a circle

questions.question: (ii) State the equations of the horizontal tangents to the circle.
(iii) Find the range of values of k for which L does not intersect the circle.
questions.question_type: Finding equation of circle and determining if a point lies on, is inside, or outside a circle

questions.question: It is given that k = 1. The point on the line L that is closest to the circle is P. (iv) Find the coordinates of P.
questions.question_type: Finding coordinates of unknown collinear point, Application of tangent in circle

questions.question: 10 (i) Show that 1/4 d/dx e^(-x) = (1/4)e^(-x) - 1.
questions.category: Differentiation of trigonometric, logarithmic, and exponential functions and their applications

questions.question: (ii) Hence show that ∫ e^(-x) dx = (1/4)e^(-x) - 1/4 e^(-x) + C where C is a constant.
questions.question_type: Integration of exponential functions, Integration as a reverse process of differentiation

questions.question: (iii) The diagram shows part of the curve y = (1/4)e^(-x). The point M is the maximum point of the curve and OM is a straight line. Show that the area of the shaded region is (40 - 16e^(-1)) units^2.
questions.question_type: Area under curve, Area bounded by curve and line

questions.question: The temperature, Cθ°, of a liquid placed in a container can be modelled by an equation of the form 32btae θ−=+, where a and b are constants and t is the time in minutes that the liquid has been left in the container. The table below records the value of θ for various values of t. t minutes 0 10 20 30 Cθ° 120.0 107.6 97.7 88.0 (i) On the grid given, plot ln(32)θ− against t and draw a straight line graph. (ii) Use the graph to estimate the value of each of the constants a and b. (v) Use the graph to estimate when the temperature of the liquid drops to 100°C.
questions.question_type: Graphs of exponential and logarithmic functions, Real-life applications of logarithms, Solving equations involving natural logarithms
